conversation.text: Let's begin the recipe.
evidence: Preheat the oven

conversation.text: Where do we start?
We will start by preheating the oven to 350 F
evidence: Preheat the oven.
Turn on your oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)

conversation.text: Ok, I have done that - what next?
We will take a 12 hole muffin tin and either grease and flour, or line it with cupcake liners.
evidence: Take a 12 hole muffin tin and grease and flour it.
You could also line the muffin pan with cupcake liners or just use cooking spray.

conversation.text: Ok, great - now how do we start preparing the cupcakes?
We will start by placing the dry ingredients from the recipe into a medium bowl, and whisking to combine.
evidence: Place the dry ingredients in a medium-sized bowl and whisk to combine them.
1 1/4 cups (156 g) of all-purpose flour
1/3 cup (40 g) of cocoa powder
1 1/2 teaspoon of baking powder
1 teaspoon of baking soda
1/2 teaspoons of salt

conversation.text: Ok, I have done that and my mixture is lumpy, how should I fix it?
You should not see lumps - continue to mix until smooth
evidence: You shouldn't be able to see any lumps

conversation.text: Ok, the mixture looks smooth and light-brown. What's next?
Now we will take a large bowl and mix together our wet ingredients
evidence: 2 mashed bananas and 1/2 cup (100 g) of granulated sugar into a separate large bowl
Stir them together. Stir in the following wet ingredients:
1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons (82 g) of vegetable oil
1/2 cup (120 ml) of milk
1 teaspoon of vanilla extract

conversation.text: Should I add them all at once?
No. First put together the bananas and sugar. Stir together, then add in the oil, milk, and vanilla extract.
evidence: Stir them together. Stir in the following wet ingredients:

conversation.text: Ok. Is it ready to combine with the dry?
Yes, now you may stir together.
evidence: Stir together the eggless chocolate cupcake batter

conversation.text: Is there a best way to combine?
First add a small amount of dry ingredients to the wet and stir, and then add the remaining until there are no lumps.
evidence: Add a little of the dry ingredient mixture to your large bowl of wet ingredients and stir it together,
Add the rest of the dry ingredients and stir the batter until there aren't any lumps or pockets of flour

conversation.text: Looks great - can I add something like nuts?
Sure - you can add a 1/2 cup of nuts, chopped, for some added crunch during this step
evidence: If you want a little crunch in your cupcakes, you can add 1/2 cup of chopped nuts.

conversation.text: Are the cupcakes ready to put into the tin?
Yes - fill the liners or holes until 3/4 full, and then place in the preheated oven for 15 to 17 minutes
evidence: Fill the muffin liners or holes so that they're three-quarters full of batter.
Bake the cupcakes for 15 to 17 minutes in your preheated oven

conversation.text: How will I know when the cupcakes are ready?
Did you test with a cake center? Did it come away clean?
evidence: A cake tester should come away clean if you poke the center of a cupcake with it.

conversation.text: Yes, the cake tester is clean.
Great! They are ready to come out of the oven. Make sure to let them cool on a wire rack completely before you frost them with the frosting or icing of your choice!
Thank you! These turned out great.
Thank you, and have a great day!
Thank you - end chat

procedure.description:
Turn on your oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Take a 12 hole muffin tin and grease and flour it. You could also line the muffin pan with cupcake liners or just use cooking spray. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/b7\/Make-Eggless-Cupcakes-Step-9-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/b7\/Make-Eggless-Cupcakes-Step-9-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":508,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} You can also spray the cupcake liners so they peel away easily from the cupcakes.

Place the dry ingredients in a medium-sized bowl and whisk to combine them. You shouldn't be able to see any lumps and the cocoa should be evenly distributed so the mixture is a light brown color. Put these dry ingredients in the bowl:
1 1/4 cups (156 g) of all-purpose flour
1/3 cup (40 g) of cocoa powder
1 1/2 teaspoon of baking powder
1 teaspoon of baking soda
1/2 teaspoons of salt

Put 2 mashed bananas and 1/2 cup (100 g) of granulated sugar into a separate large bowl. Stir them together. Stir in the following wet ingredients:
1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons (82 g) of vegetable oil
1/2 cup (120 ml) of milk
1 teaspoon of vanilla extract

procedure.summary: Stir together the eggless chocolate cupcake batter.
procedure.description: Add a little of the dry ingredient mixture to your large bowl of wet ingredients and stir it together, using a rubber spatula or wooden spoon. Add the rest of the dry ingredients and stir the batter until there aren't any lumps or pockets of flour. If you want a little crunch in your cupcakes, you can add 1/2 cup of chopped nuts. If you want a stronger chocolate flavor, add 1/2 cup of chocolate chips.

Fill the muffin liners or holes so that they're three-quarters full of batter. Bake the cupcakes for 15 to 17 minutes in your preheated oven. A cake tester should come away clean if you poke the center of a cupcake with it. If not, let them bake for a few more minutes and then test them again. Let the cupcakes cool completely on a wire rack before you frost them with a frosting or icing of your choice.
